level.heading: Performance management system.
level.text: The performance management system shall provide for:
The development of individual performance plans for all employees;
Ratings based on one or more of the following performance management components:
Standards;
Objectives;
Real-time tasks and assignments; and
Competencies;

Up to 5 rating levels, the highest of which shall constitute an outstanding performance rating for purposes of § 1-624.02(b)(3) and the lowest of which shall constitute an unacceptable performance rating for purposes of § 1-624.02(b)(4);
A rating process, with (at a minimum) annual evaluations which may include input from citizens, customers, peers, the employee, subordinates, and supervisors;
A removal and reconsideration process, which may include the alternatives of reassignment and demotion; and
An opportunity to demonstrate an improvement in performance during the reconsideration process.

level.heading: Section References
level.text: This section is referenced in § 1-613.51.

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: D.C. Law 13-131 rewrote subd. (3), which previously read:
"Rating levels of:
"(A) Exceeds expectations (outstanding);
"(B) Achieved expectations;
"(C) Below expectations; and
"(D) Failed expectations (unacceptable);".

level.heading: Temporary Amendment of Section
level.text: For temporary (225 day) amendment of section, see § 2(b) of Performance Rating Levels Temporary Amendment Act of 1999 (D.C. Law 13-85, April 12, 2000, law notification 47 DCR 2642).

level.heading: Emergency Legislation
level.text: For temporary (90-day) amendment of section, see § 2(b) of the Performance Rating Levels Emergency Amendment Act of 1999 (D.C. Act 13-206, December 8, 1999, 46 DCR 10468).
